ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I worked with Professor Helen Siu to develop my senior thesis on the role of inter-city climate networks in local flood management.
Good time to work on thesis

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course revolves around on your relationship with your thesis advisor. Whether or not you benefit from the course will depend on how you and your advisor decide to structure a weekly research schedule.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, if you are doing independent reading. there could be more guidance from the DUS/prof to check on progress. i.e like a bibliography due or something else to get started/ make sure you are on top of it.
I would recommend that anthropology majors pursue the yearlong thesis. The thesis has allowed me to take ownership of a project that aligns perfectly with my academic and professional interests.
Take it if you want to get a credit for doing thesis work
